intro: Cerinthe glabra subsp. caucasica, commonly known as Caucasian horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is characterized by its distinctive, horn-shaped seed pods and striking red-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
